article.title: Northrop Grumman Receives $128 Million Contract to Supply Army With Lightweight Laser Designator Rangefinders
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: Northrop Grumman Corporation has received a $128 million, firm-fixed-priced contract from the U.S. Army to provide lightweight laser designator rangefinder systems, which provide battle-proven targeting capability for laser-guided, Global Positioning System-guided and conventional munitions.
